item.title: Minecraft
item.description: So I, used to be pretty into Minecraft. That was, back in 2008.   In primary school, I used to play with my friends on a vanilla server, Icecraft. In high school, I started getting into modding and server administration. We played with the Feed The Beast modpack, and eventually we played our own modpack, BearCrack.   I got into server administration - running servers, and contributing to Bukkit plugins.

item.title: Brilliant Smart - WiFi LED Lights
item.description: I went to ALDI today and impulsively bought two boxes of these Brilliant Smart WiFi LED lights $50 for three bulbs… $100 for six bulbs… Seemed like a pretty good purchase to me - I could use them with my Home Assistant setup in my house! These Brilliant Smart lights are just rebranded Tuya lights. The first thing to do was to flash the bulb’s firmware with either Tasmota or ESPHome - custom firmwares for smart devices that would allow me to interact with them.

item.title: Mi Band 4
item.description: My brother and I have been eyeing on a sale for the Mi Band 4, and we finally swooped to buy them at $40 AUD each! I used to have a Mi Band 2, and one thing I liked about it was being able to see my Facebook Messenger notifications on them. The Mi Band 4 is definitely an upgrade. For starters, it has a larger screen with a much higher resolution.

item.title: Sonoff Mini
item.description: I ordered a Sonoff Mini, and it arrived in the mail today. I’m planning to connect it to my ceiling lights. First thing’s first, Tasmota time! We’ll be flashing Sonoff-Tasmota via Sonoff DIY OTA mode. Steps Disclaimer: This device plays with LIVE ELECTRICITY. Don’t kill yourself. 0) Download the stuff you need - Sonoff DIY Tool - Tasmota firmware file (ie sonoff-basic.bin 2.3.0) 1) Update the firmware To first update the firmware, we need to make sure that the Sonoff Mini’s stock firmware is at least version 3.

item.title: Laptop Reinstall
item.description: I’ve been dual-booting my Dell Latitude 7390 with Windows 10 and Parrot since the start of 2018. Recently, my Windows 10 installation had been bombarding me with a barrage of pretty blue screens with the WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR message whenever I connected a USB device. I tried updating my BIOS and other firmwares, nope. I tried uninstalling softwares and drivers, nope. I tried removing my Parrot OS microSD card, nope. I tried to not plug in any USB device ever again… it then started to crash even without a USB inserted.

item.title: RICE Rally 2019 Sydney
item.description: I’m back at it again doing vision playback for RICE Rally 2019 at ICC Sydney! Technologies: Playback - ProPresenter 6 Playback - CasparCG Video Transport - NewTek NDI Video Mixing - Open Broadcaster Software See Production on a Budget Technical: Timecode ProPresenter 6 does not have any timecode slave triggering, and we didn’t have any software (PVP, and a Mac) on us that would allow for that. We had to manually sync the track by counting over our intercoms…

item.title: Parsec
item.description: Parsec is a software designed to help people play offline multiplayer games - online. This is done by streaming the display, whilst also emulating keyboard, mouse, and even game controller input. Getting started Getting Parsec set up was straightforward. Firstly, download the server software. Then install the client software (ie on Google Play store, Google Chrome extension). Create an account, log in, press connect and you’re good to go!

item.title: Fear and Tension
item.description: Fear is subjective, tension is objective. - Some YouTube video. I was watching a video [3:30] about how games (in this case Metroid Fusion) evoke emotion from the player - despite it just being a game. Aided by sound effects, music, lighting, dialogue and story telling; our minds are synchronised with in-game character; and it’s pretty amazing to consider that it was all purpose-driven by the game creators. Fear and Tension.

item.title: Back to Firefox
item.description: Why I left I stopped using Firefox in the late of November 2016, when Mozilla decided to pull the plug on, and severely restricted Firefox’s add-on platform, in favour of their WebExtensions API. This issue with this was that the WebExtensions API was relatively high-level - meaning that my favourite extensions (ie DownThemAll!) would cease to work, as they relied on low level access. Not being able to use DownThemAll! was a game changer for me - it was hands down the secret weapon under the sleeves of my Firefox vs Chrome war.

item.title: City Hunter
item.description: Uni holidays. Preoccupied myself with watching some Korean Drama. My friend recommended me some series called City Hunter. And… it… was… alright actually! I even watched some bits at 1x speed! Spoiler Time Some Koreans go and do a secret mission in North Korea. They complete their objective, but their gov chucks a sneaky and abandons them. One survives, then steals the newborn of a fallen comrade’s wife and raises him up.

So my friend wanted to upgrade from their iPhone to a Galaxy S9+. Personally, I don’t really care much about getting brand new goods (exceptions exist), so off to the races! Hopped on eBay, Gumtree and Facebook Marketplace to check for some sweet deals. I found a few classifieds from a store called Masters iPhone - supposedly located in Western Australia.

item.title: RICE Rally 2018 Sydney
item.description: In a world full of noise, how do we find what we’re really looking for? RICE Movement is a Christian organisation that brings the message of Jesus to high schoolers (of Australia, and now New Zealand too!) RICE Rally is their annual event, a big evangelical ‘rally’. I got the opportunity to serve with my brother in the Production team (that is, lyrics and projection). Our playground was three LED walls (and two confidence monitors)!

item.title: Windows Updates - Sketchpad KB4505903
item.description: Having finally fixed my laptop, I booted into Windows to try to get some work done. However, since KB4505903, Windows had removed Sketchpad! You know, the only useful ink workspace app. Unfortunately, KB4505903 was not actually installed (rather some later version), and I don’t have the time nor patience to figure out which later update to remove. Bummer. I guess I’ll try out the “replacement” app, Whiteboard. UPDATE Having tried Whiteboard… it’s not bad.
